byline.contributor: Gabby Sobelman contributed reporting from Rehovot, Israel.

abstract: Death of Jewish settler Alexander Levlovich, caused by rock thrown on his car in Ramallah, West Bank, impels Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu to call emergency meeting to discuss harsher measures for rock-throwers; Israeli police report 53 percent increase in stone-throwing episodes; incident occurs as police and Palestinian youth battle at Al Aqsa Mosque, site in Jerusalem considered holy by both Jews and Muslims.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called an emergency meeting to discuss a series of such attacks, mostly by Palestinian youths.

headline.main: Jewish Man Dies as Rocks Pelt His Car in East Jerusalem
headline.print_headline: Jewish Man Dies as Rocks Pelt His Car in West Bank

snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called an emergency meeting to discuss a series of such attacks, mostly by Palestinian youths.
